title: Tech
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Is Craigslist the Last Real Place on the Internet?
items.description: Millennials are still using Craigslist to find jobs, find love, and even to cast creative projects—eschewing other AI- and algorithm-dominated online ...

items.title: How Mormons Helped Make America’s Prepping Industry Into Big Business
items.description: How two big names in mainstream disaster preparedness helped sell Americans on fear, anxiety and a new generator.

items.title: Former Bolt CEO Maju Kuruvilla’s startup triples to $100M valuation
items.description: Spangle has raised $15 million in a Series A round to expand its AI-generated shopping experiences.

items.title: Why this VC thinks 2026 will be ‘the year of the consumer’
items.description: AI adoption in enterprise is stalling as companies don't know where to start. Vanessa Larco of Premise VC thinks 2026 will be the year of the consumer...

items.title: Bose Promo Code: 40% Off Bose for January 2026
items.description: Enjoy at least 40% off headphones, speakers, soundbars, and other audio products from Bose.

items.title: This Is the Blood Glucose Monitor We’ve Been Waiting For
items.description: Makers of smartwatches and other wearables have spent years trying to measure blood sugar without pricking your skin. The PreEvnt Issac does just that...

items.title: Gmail debuts a personalized AI Inbox, AI Overviews in search, and more
items.description: Gmail is also bringing several AI features that were previously available only to paid users to all users.

items.title: JPMorgan Chase becomes the new issuer of the Apple Card
items.description: Apple expects the transition to take 24 months

items.title: Peacock Promo Codes: 16% Off January 2026
items.description: Stream your favorite shows for up to $80 off this month, and save on subscription plans with the latest Peacock TV coupons from WIRED.

items.title: Hands on with a prototype of Clicks’ Communicator, a new BlackBerry-like smartphone
items.description: TechCrunch goes hands-on at the CES 2025 show with the new Clicks Communicator, a new Android smartphone with a physical keyboard.
